quote: Ship's log, stardate 42625.4,   First Officer Riker reporting.   We have achieved orbit around   Theta Eight...
... the planet furthest from its   sun in this previously unmapped   solar system. It is a world of   ruthless realities: particularly   harsh, barren, and inhospitable...
Our reason for being here -- a   passing Klingon cruiser reported   discovering pieces of a strange   vessel in the upper atmosphere.   We've come to investigate...
Nasty. Nitrogen... methane...   liquid neon. Surface temperature   minus two hundred and ninety-one   degrees Fahrenheit. Winds up to   three hundred and twelve meters   per second.
Not exactly a vacation planet,   eh?
Uh uh. Not unless you like   ammonia tornadoes. Or orange   lightning bolts for that matter.
Not my cup of tea. Found anything   artificial in the atmosphere?
Nothing so far. We're just coming   around to the night side now.
Keep me informed. The sooner we   identify what the Klingons think   they saw, the sooner we can get   the hell out of here.
Sounds good to me.
Nasty.
Come.
Fermat's last theorem. Familiar   with it?
No. I'm afraid I spent too many   math classes daydreaming about   being on a starship.

It's intriguing. When Fermat died   they found scrawled in the margin   of his notes that he had found   a "remarkable proof."       Unfortunately he never lived to   write it down. And for the last   eight hundred years people have   been trying to rediscover it.
And that includes you?
I find the process relaxing.
We've detected debris of some sort   in a loose orbit.
Can you identify?
I suggest we beam a section aboard   for analysis.
Make it so, Number One.
Energize.
We've locked onto something with   markings on it.
What sort of markings?
Uncertain, sir.
There's something here.
That symbol... Do you recognize   it?
Yes sir. I -- I think I do.
Metallic analysis bears out that   the object in question was   terrestrial in origin. Most   likely late twenty-first century.
But that's not possible. No ship   of that time period could have   come this far.
Nevertheless, that is what our   tests indicate. And the markings   we discovered are consistent with   this hypothesis.
Any idea what destroyed it? An   explosion of some sort?
Unknown.
The question is, how did it get   here?
Captain. We've detected a large   structure on the planet.
It is a building of some sort,   situated on a plane of frozen   methane, smack in the middle of   a tremendous storm belt. It is   incongruous; it simply should not   be there!
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Are you certain it's artificially   constructed?
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Absolutely. The structure is   surrounded by breathable air.
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: It's hard to accept...
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Yet it does seem to be down there.   Is there a connection between the   structure and the ship?
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Suggestions?
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Only one, sir. Suggest we go down   and have a look.
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Form an away team, minimal   complement.
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Let's see if we can find the   architects.
scene: 12   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SCREEN

quote: Give me a moment, gents. We're   dealing with an extremely narrow   access point.

quote: We're ready when you are...       Phasers on stun.
scene: 15   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ON DATA AND WORF

quote: Energize.
scene: 15   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ON DATA AND WORF

quote: Where are we?
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Exactly where Geordi said we would   be. The structure is directly   behind us.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: I am detecting vast ammonia storms   raging mere kilometers away. Yet   they do not appear to penetrate   this breathable zone.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: It's like the eye of a hurricane.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: It is here. It must be here, yet   we cannot see it.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Enterprise, this is Commander   Riker. We have arrived in a very   unusual place... it is like being   in the eye of a hurricane. It   is completely calm, no sound, no   movement, yet a few meters away   a storm, which we can neither see   nor hear, is raging.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Describe the structure.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: We can't see it.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Commander, over here. I see   something!
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: What is this thing?
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: What is it, Commander?
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: I think it's a door. An antique.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Judging by its location, it may   be an entrance to the structure   we seek.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Well... this is what we came here   for.       Captain, we are entering the   structure.
scene: 18   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER (OPTICAL)
location: PLANET SURFACE - DATA, WORF AND RIKER

quote: Riker to Enterprise. We have   entered the structure.       We're not getting through.
Where's that interference   originating?
From the source, sir. Cause...   unknown.
Lock onto the landing party.   Have the Transporter Room prepare   to beam them up.
We can't distinguish them as long   as they're inside that structure.
Can they hear us?
We've got to recalibrate all   frequencies.
Make it so.
Without radio contact, we should   leave immediately.
Agreed. We'll make a preliminary   sweep of this environment and then   return.
Checking in, gentlemen? You'll   have to go to the front desk.
Welcome, gentlemen. Have a nice   trip?
Uh... Do you know us?
We've been expecting you. A trio   of foreign gentlemen.
We're from the United Federation   of Planets --
Of course. Welcome to The Hotel   Royale...
Did Rita call?
No -- and for your own good you   had better quit thinking about   Rita.
I'm not afraid of him.
Then you're a fool. Everybody   with any sense is afraid of Mikey   D.
(waves off the thought     of Mikey D)   If Rita calls -- you let me know.

(confidentially to     Riker)   The kid's just askin' for trouble   -- Rita's too much for him to   handle, and Mikey D will plant   his face in the pavement.    (then, handing them     to Riker)   Now, here are your room keys and   some complimentary casino chips.   Enjoy!
What is this place? How did a   being like you get here?
Why this is the Royale, of   course. And my personal life is   really none of your business,   thank you.
What he means is, what planet   is this?
I beg your pardon?
This planet. What do you call   it?
Earth.       What do you call it?
We call it Theta Eight.
How charming.
Commander...
Yes Data?
(reading from his     tricorder)   None of these people... are   emitting life signs.
You mean they're not alive?
Then what are they?...
These beings... are they machines,       or mere illusions, designed to   deceive us?
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Not illusions, Lieutenant. They   do exist, but they do not register   as either man or machine.
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: For example, this creature   exhibits no DNA structure.
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Look who's talkin'.       He sounds just like my ex-wife.
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Aaaaall right!! Time to get back   to business!
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: What sort of business do you   suppose he is getting down to?
scene: 26   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Status report?
We're attempting to employ   alternate encoding schemes.
There are hundreds of possible   combinations, Captain.
Is there an intelligence causing   the interference?
Impossible to tell, Captain.
You're new around here, aren't   you?
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Yes. I have certainly never   visited this place, or its true   counterpart, before.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Sit down, boy. I'll show you how   this game is played.       Go ahead. Ante up.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: It seems he expects something of   me.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: He wants you to cut the cards.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Ah, is this poker?
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: No, it's blackjack.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Also known as twenty-one, a   number which defines the object   of the game. Tens and picture   cards are worth ten, ace -- one   or eleven -- the other cards face   value. The dealer must hit   seventeen -- five cards under pays   double.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Not at this joint -       Run 'em, boy. And make 'em   friendly. There's no bread in   the house.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Aren't you going to look at your   hand?       Poor girl needs to win.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Fifteen - do I hit, Texas, or   stand?
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: If you've got to win -- then you've   got to hit.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Hit me.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Damn!
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Hit me.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Twenty-one -- a winner.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Having fun, Data?
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Fun, sir? While there is a   certain amount of enjoyment   involved I was mainly conducting   research into --
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: -- Save it, Data. We're getting   out of here.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Understood, sir.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Hey, you're holding up the game.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Our apologies. Come on, Data.
scene: 31   INT. ROYALE CASINO - ENTRANCE - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Try it again.
scene: 40   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Sir, there is no other exit point.   Unless we can find another way...   it seems we are trapped here.
scene: 40   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Captain's log, supplemental. We   remain in orbit around Theta   Eight, still out of contact with   the away team.
Phasers are totally ineffective   on all surfaces.
scene: 42   INT. ROYALE CASINO - RIKER AND DATA

quote: (to Riker, showing his     own variety of concern     now)   I am checking options... they   seem quite limited --
scene: 42   INT. ROYALE CASINO - RIKER AND DATA

quote: We don't have any. If we're ever   going to get out of here, we'll   have to do it on our own.       I'm going to get some answers out   of that desk clerk...
scene: 42   INT. ROYALE CASINO - RIKER AND DATA

quote: Are you crazy?
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Wrong. I'm finally getting some   smarts --
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: You think you're gonna scare Mikey   D with that thing?
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: I'm gonna make him leave Rita   alone.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Kid, she's a big girl... and she's   Mikey D's girl.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Not any more. Not after tonight.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Look. I like you. I don't want   to see you get hurt... especially   over some dame --
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Don't call her that!    (then, eyes welling up     with anger)   You'll see! You'll see how tough   Mikey D is! He's nothin'!
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: I want some answers!
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: The concierge can help you with   any --
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: We want out of here. Now.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: I'm afraid you've missed your   check-out time. We do have our   rules, you know.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: I mean out of the building. We   want to get outside --
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: The Royale's exits are clearly   marked.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: That's not good enough.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: If you have a complaint about the   service you've received during   your stay, you can always take   it up with the manager.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Fine! I'd like to see him   immediately!
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: I'm afraid the manager is very   busy.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: ... Riker, can you read me?
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Yes, go ahead.
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: Enterprise?... Enterprise?...
scene: 43   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - FRONT DESK - THE BELLBOY

quote: ... Enterprise...
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON PICARD AND TROI

quote: Why haven't you left the   building, Number One?
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON PICARD AND TROI

quote: ... Tried... Trapped here... No   immediate danger...
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ON PICARD AND TROI

quote: Something at your location is   interfering with our exchange...   Working on the problem...
scene: 45   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - NEAR ELEVATOR - RIKER

quote: These frequencies aren't   working.
Then find another.
Yes sir.
What is going on down there?
Commander... I am picking up   something most unusual in another   section of this structure.   Indications of DNA.
scene: 47   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - NEAR REGISTRATION DESK

quote: Where?
scene: 47   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - NEAR REGISTRATION DESK

quote: Thirty-one point nine meters   above and to the right of us.
scene: 47   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - NEAR REGISTRATION DESK

quote: Perhaps those turbolifts could   take us there.
scene: 47   INT. ROYALE LOBBY - NEAR REGISTRATION DESK

quote: The reading I got is behind this   door.
scene: 48   INT. ROYALE - SEVENTH FLOOR HALLWAY - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: My reading is intensifying.
Life signs?
None.
Definitely human. Male.
Looks like the poor devil died   in its sleep.
What a terrible way to go.
He has been dead for two hundred   eighty-three years. The lack of   any advanced decomposition is   attributable to the sterile   environment.
Commander, look here.
Is that... this "Las Vegas" you   spoke about?
I believe that's what the   illusion is meant to be.
(moving, looking around     the room)   Why would anyone go to all this   trouble? It's all just... window   dressing for a dead man.
Is this significant, sir?
American. Fifty-two stars -- that   would date it between 2053 and   2079 A.D.
(continuing;     reading name)   Colonel S. Richey.
Rest in peace, Colonel.
Picard to Riker.
Finally.       Riker. Go ahead.
What's your situation?
We are locked in a structure made   to resemble twentieth century   Earth -- all efforts to exit have   failed.
We can't transport.
I assumed as much. Captain, we   have located the remains of a   human.
Request identity scan on a   Colonel Richey, American, first   initial S., roughly same time   period.
scene: 53   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - ON RIKER

quote: We also need a computer library   check on hotel known as the   Royale; possible location, Las   Vegas, Nevada, circa twenty-first   century.
Get on it.
Information retrieved, Captain --

Colonel Stephen Richey was the   commanding officer of the   explorer ship Charybdis which   had a terrestrial launch date of   7-23-2067. It was the first   manned attempt to travel beyond   the confines of the Euclidian   solar system. Its telemetry   system failed and it was never   heard from again...       Why is this of interest, Number   One?
The frequency scramble remains   unpredictable, sir...
Commander? Some curiosities...
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: Books... A novel...       "The Royale Hotel"...       Summarize.
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: The story of a group of compulsive   gamblers caught up in the web of   crime, corruption and deceit spun   by nefarious lothario Mikey D who   appears only at the climax to be   brought to his knees by a   heartbroken bellboy. There is   a subplot about an older man   conspiring with a younger woman   to murder her husband while   squandering her inheritance. The   writing is elementary, the   plotting predictable, the   characters one-dimensional. The   only thing of interest, quite   honestly, is the intriguing   setting, that of a Las Vegas   gambling casino-hotel --
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: This novel... and everyone in   it you've just described...   that's this hotel...
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: This... this appears to be a   diary... but with only one   entry...    (reading from it with     great interest now)   "I write this in the hope that   it will someday be read by human   eyes... I can only surmise at this   point, but apparently our   exploratory shuttle was   contaminated by an alien life-form   which infected and killed all   personnel except myself. I   awakened to find myself here in   The Royale Hotel... and for the   last thirty-eight years I have   survived here.
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: "I have come to understand that   this place was created for me   out of some sense of guilt,   presuming that the novel we had   on board was in fact a guide to   our preferred lifestyle and social   habits. Obviously, they thought   this was the world from which I   came. I hold no malice toward   my benefactors... they could not   possibly know the hell they have   put me through, for it was such   a badly written book, filled with   endless cliche and shallow   characters. I shall welcome death   when it comes... "
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: Then that is why... all of this   is here. But why can't we get   out?
scene: 57   INT. ROYALE - RICHEY'S SUITE - RIKER AND DATA

quote: Suppose we phaser a slice in the   field which surrounds the   structure?
Yes...
That would mean the atmosphere   of the planet would instantly rush   in.
How long would they live under   those conditions?
A minute -- maybe less.
But you could revive them.
Well, that would depend on how   long they were exposed, how soon   I got to them, but Captain   realistically... I wouldn't give   them much of a chance. I'm a   doctor -- not a magician.
I understand the risk, but I will   not warp off and leave them.       Make your preparations.
Yes, sir.
Yes?    (listens, frowns, turns     to others)   There is a female voice asking   if we want... "room service."
I believe they are asking if we   want the room cleaned.
Tell them no.
No.
What'd she say?
She said... "The kitchen's open   twenty-four hours if we change   our minds."
I'm going to explore the other   floors; you two go down to the   lobby, see if we've missed   anything. Talk to the other   "guests" -- try and find out who   and what they are.
I suggest we separate and blend   in with these beings. Casual   queries offered in an   inconspicuous manner might prove   most fruitful.
scene: 62   INT. ROYALE CASINO - BLACKJACK TABLE - THE DEALER

quote: What?
scene: 62   INT. ROYALE CASINO - BLACKJACK TABLE - THE DEALER

quote: Mingle, Worf. Mingle.
scene: 62   INT. ROYALE CASINO - BLACKJACK TABLE - THE DEALER

quote: How much do I have left?
Honey, it's bad luck to count your   chips at the table...
If I might inquire, where are you   from, sir?
Lubbock, Texas.
How did you get here?
To Vegas? Drove. Got a   ninety-six caddy with only eighty   thousand miles on her.
And where is your automobile now?
Hit?
It's out front, I suppose. What   the hell difference does it make?
Could you take me there?
I'm losing my shirt here --
Now son, why would I wanna do   that? Can't you see I'm tryin'   to to help this little lady?
I do not believe you could go to   your car, even if it truly exists.   You are trapped inside the Royale,   just as I am.

Sure does feel that way when   you're losin', doesn't it? But   right now we're tryin' to turn   this lady's wagon and win back   some lost change. Otherwise she's   goin' to be in a desperate   situation with nowhere to turn.       Well, almost nowhere.
I stay, right?
I wouldn't.
The odds favor standing pat.
What do I do?
You want a card or what?
Too many.
That's everything I had. I've   lost it all. What am I going to   do?
There, there...
You were told.
It's not for you to make the   call... it's for Rita.
She sent me to tell you.
Boys -- we can't afford to have   any trouble here -- take it   outside.
Yeah -- I like that... come on,   baggage man... let's you and me   take it outside.
Watch yourself.
Don't worry.
It's all part of the novel. Don't   interfere.
You should have listened, kid   no woman is worth dying for...   killing for... but not dying for.
How can he leave?
It is on page 244.
The book... Then... how does it   end?
A bad love affair ends in a bloody   shoot-out, the hotel gets bought   out and life goes on... such as   it is --
The hotel gets bought? By whom?
It is not very specific. The   acquiring party is simply referred   to as "foreign investors." Sale   price, twelve point five million.
That's how we're getting out.   We're buying this place.

(sighs with     frustration)   Number One... If we don't take   some action, make some attempt -- however   dangerous it may be -- to   rescue you, you may very   well be lost to the confines of   that conundrum for all eternity.   That is certain death for you   all... and that...       ... that is unacceptable! We   have set phaser focus with energy   ratios sufficient to penetrate   the structure --
Hold on that. There may be   another way. I'll keep you   informed.
It is a question of decimal   percentages. Quite simple, really   if one bets with any sequential   consistency.
Can you do it?
Certainly.
C'mon, sugar, seven-come-eleven   and we're on easy street --
Snake eyes.
I'm almost broke!
Baby, relax! It's only money --
But if I lose it all, I won't   even have a place to sleep.
Don't worry your pretty little   head. I'd never let that happen.
It's your roll, sir...
Go to work.
Maybe this turkey'll change our   luck --
Six. The point is six --
Six! Hell, my blind grandmother   can make a six! Let 'er rip, boy!
Seven. Seven and out...
So much for your new turkey --
These cubes are improperly   balanced. I believe that their   final resting position is   adversely affected --
Loaded dice.       Can you... "repair" them?
I believe so...
Seven! A winner!
Attaboy! Just do that a few more   times and everybody's gonna get   well --
Who has the dice?
Oh, Tex, darlin', you're   brilliant!
Yeah. An' good lookin' too, huh?
Isn't that enough?
Almost. I don't want to be short,   that's for sure...       You are keeping count?
Eleven point three million.       Perhaps I will bet it all --
No! Simply reach twelve million.
As you wish...
The man has the touch.
Now.
I would like to cash out, please.
I'm afraid you've broken the bank.   That's over twelve million --
Twelve point five million to be   exact. The purchase price of   this hotel.
That's impossible --
Wrong. We're the "foreign   Investors" on page 244. We're   buying you out, lock, stock, and   barrel.    (slides the chips toward     the pit boss)   Consider it a "done deal."
Hey, y'know what? Y'all got   style! I like that! Let me buy   y'all a drink --
Enjoy the game, friend. And don't   let 'em change the dice on you.
Wait! You can't leave!
Oh yeah? Watch us.    (then, wagging a finger     at him)   Don't forget, we own the joint.
You're confident about this,   Commander?
Focus. Concentrate. See only   where we want to BE, not where   we are.
Ancient philosophical overtones   of thought process... "Zen", I   believe --
We own the place... and we're   walking through that door...
I think it's time to go home...
scene: 92   EXT. PLANET SURFACE - THE BLACK VOID

quote: Transporter Room, we have a fix   on our away team. Beam them up...   and please be quick about it!
